title: Rate of change of water in a tank at a given time

content.question: The number of gallons of water in a storage tank at time t, in minutes, is modeled by w(t) = 25 − t2 for <math> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>5</mn> </mrow> </math>. At what rate, in gallons per minute, is the amount of water in the tank changing at time t = 3 minutes?

topic.text: 4.1: Interpreting the Meaning of the Derivative in Context

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
